news.title: ‘Tom Niland protected rural Ireland by taking these guys out of the system’ – friends pay tribute as third man pleads guilty to his manslaughter
news.summary: The obscene brutality of the attack that led to the death of bachelor farmer Tom Niland remains a permanent scar in the hearts of his community.

news.title: Woman who tripped over vacuum cleaner in Supermac’s has personal injuries claim dismissed
news.summary: A woman had her personal injuries claim against fast-food restaurant Supermac’s dismissed after a judge found she was “wholly distracted” by her phone when she claimed she tripped over a vacuum cleaner.

news.title: Sliotargate and the donkey derby – hurling’s bitter rivalry between Tipperary and Cork is reborn
news.summary: First things first. Avid horse racing fan Babs Keating was not specifically talking about Cork when he used that unfortunate metaphor about donkeys not winning derbies before the 1990 Munster final … it’s just that’s how his words were manipulated to suit the narrative.

news.title: Trump denies ‘bawdy letter’ to Epstein and threatens to sue Wall Street Journal as storm grows
news.summary: President Donald Trump announced plans to sue the Wall Street Journal after the paper published a bombshell report detailing an alleged bawdy birthday card Trump gave to Jeffrey Epstein.

news.title: The Open: Rory McIlroy gets second round underway on day two at Royal Portrush
news.summary: It’s a massive week in Royal Portrush as the 153rd Open Championship takes place.

news.title: Bill Linnane: I’m conscious of making the most of my time with my kids – shame I can’t understand a word they’re saying
news.summary: I try to keep up with youth culture. It could be trying to figure out what ‘skibidi Ohio rizz’ means, investigating the cold case killing of John Pork by Tim Cheese, or even becoming conversationally fluent in Italian Brainrot.

news.title: Dónal Lynch: Gregg Wallace showed that no matter how bad a situation is for a public figure, they can always make it worse
news.summary: Gregg Wallace ­finally got there. Like a ­ MasterChef  contestant frantically rushing to plate up in time for the gong, Wallace ­belatedly said he was “deeply sorry” this week for the long list of now proven allegations against him.

news.title: Rosie O’Donnell saves choking woman (90) at Dublin restaurant: ‘I’m good in a crisis but I’m a mess afterwards’
news.summary: American comedian Rosie O’Donnell has revealed how she came to the rescue of an elderly woman while eating at a restaurant in Dublin on Wednesday night.

news.title: ‘There’s no need for anyone to own 15 pairs of leggings’ – how I made hundreds of euro selling my clutter on Vinted
news.summary: In just one month, I made hundreds of euro by selling my stuff rather than throwing it away.

news.title: Met Éireann issues Status Yellow rain warning for two counties with risk of spot flooding and thunderstorms
news.summary: Met Éireann has issued a Status Yellow rain warning for two counties as heavy rain and possible thunderstorms are expected.
